website_summaries.verdict: A wood push walker that's well-made and strong enough to handle tough use.
pros: It's easy to push but has enough resistance that your baby won't fall on his face
Kids love to put toys in the basket
cons: Doesn't push in a straight line and is difficult to turn

customer_reviews.title: Long-lasting, well-made, enjoyable toy
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't "turn" but that makes it more secure for a one-year-old and easily figured out a few months later. It is expensive, but less garish than the plastic ones AND she still plays with and "in" it a lot now that she is past two. She strolls her stuffed animals up and down the hallway, and gets her daddy to push her in it. Band around wheels prevents marring and reduces noise. Small enough to use in tight quarters, big enough for a tall toddler. Delightful push toy plus.
customer_reviews.author: TwoTexans

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, wish it had bumpers
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for 3 and a half years. It has been loaded up with tons of toys and pushed miles and miles by 2 kids (and quite a few friends also). The kids also like to get rides in it. It is very sturdy and also well balanced. My only complaint is that it can be very hard on the baseboards. I wish they had put the same rubber that is on the wheels along the front edge, so it’s not so brutal when it gets banged into the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Great for early walkers, but good for later walkers too!
customer_reviews.text: We love this, it's so well made, wood and just the right height for early walkers. We gave this to our 9 month old (30th percentiles) and he started using it right away. He can pull up on it without it tipping over. It is heavy, much heavier than plastic ones, so turning corners needs some assistance. He loves the cogs on the side (unfortunately the only plastic part!) too, plays with them a lot. I think this would be fine for older children too who are just walking, or want something to push around with their bears in.
customer_reviews.author: Science Geek

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this walker toy
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this walker toy! And so does my 1 year old. Wanted a sturdy noise free walker that my 1 year old could actually pull to stand on, we had a fisher price one that was too flimsy for that and would flip over, but this one is sturdy with the wheels set back from handle bar making it stable enough for baby to bear weight on. In addition it has rubber grips on wheels to protect floors and slow the toy down for a new walker. The gear toys and maze toys are also a fun feature for a seated baby. Worth the extra cost for this well made toy!
customer_reviews.author: kr837

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping and exactly like pictured
customer_reviews.text: Just want to note that i said ship September 8-11 and i got it two days after order which is the 28 of August! Fast shipping, very pretty and exactly as pictured. Only thing i cant figure out is the wheels squeeqs and not sure if its intentional or something im missing. Love it though
customer_reviews.author: Maya

customer_reviews.title: By the next month he was thrilled to go to it and stroll along and wave like the flipping king of the house
customer_reviews.text: At first our boy didn't take to it. He was 9 mos and crawling. He was just pulling himself up but had no interest in doing it on the move. By the next month he was thrilled to go to it and stroll along and wave like the flipping king of the house. Walking now at 12 mos but still using it. In fact expanding his use for it. Things go in it. It can slam and crash. It can make the dogs run out of the room. I'll try to keep you posted when he begins to loose interest, but, for now, it remains a wonderfully distracting tool, I mean toy. Written by daddy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for beginner walkers
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old absolutely LOVES this toy! She puts her doll and all of her favorite toys in it and pushes it all over the place! She hasn't quite figured out how to turn around so we have to do it for her. I think that says more about my child than the product LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love this walker
customer_reviews.text: Love this walker. Super sturdy and well made wood cart. Got this for my 9 month old who we thought was about to stand up, two months later he's walking everywhere with it! He also loves playing with all of the side pieces like the gears. Great for cleaning up and storing toys too. Only negative is it's hard to steer curves. He can't turn corners with it, so we have to pick it up to turn it around once he hits the wall. Love the vibrant colors too!
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Best walker ever.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 5 years ago for my twin grandchildren. They still play with it by loading up the little wagon part or giving each oth dr r rides in it. I just bought another one for another grandchild. Her 2 year old brother likes it too.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian S Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Wheels roll too freely, it runs away from him when he leans on it. Also one of the wheels squeaks right out of the box. But he likes the toys on the side and puts stuff in it to push around like a wagon. So it's fun, but I don't know how great it is as a walker. Also bought the thing because I wanted something wooden, but randomly the gear toys on the side are plastic. Why?
customer_reviews.author: D Wick

customer_reviews.title: Marvelous Baby Walker!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nicely designed and made walker toy. My grandbaby is just past 10 months, and he was so excited about it as soon as he saw it. At first he just played with the nice little built-in toys. But now he is strutting his stuff back and forth across the living room, pushing pushing and pushing it. This toy is very solidly made, with clever little built-in toys that are quite entertaining. I was a little concerned before he started using it that the walker would flip over when he grabbed the handle, but it doesn't do that. It's sturdy and very attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Artist

customer_reviews.title: Defective - Unable to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately we were not able to assemble our walker. It must have been defective because it did not line up correctly. I'm surprised I did not see any other reviews with this problem. We have many other Hape toys, including one of their doll houses. There were many reviews about the dollhouse not assembling correctly. We lucked out on that. Hape has great customer service, unfortunately I made a rookie mistake and tried to assemble this 2 nights before Christmas. Too late to get a new one, so we sent it back. Disappointed in the quality on this one.
customer_reviews.author: LoriJ

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful walker!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my 10 month old grandson who just started pulling up and cruising. He immediately fell in love with this walker. It is heavy and sturdy enough that he can pull himself up to stand by holding the handle. He is a very big boy so I was very happy to see that it will hold his weight when he pulls up. He loves all of the knobs and activities and also immediately started putting other toys in the wagon part of the walker. It came mostly assembled. I just had to attach the handle which only took a few minutes. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE wood products for my kids
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE wood products for my kids. This is cute and decent and my 13 month old loves to sit in it and be pushed in it. We had to make some adjustments on wheels etc because if you push too hard or get too rough (like our 2-5 yr old cousins did) it can get ruined very fast. All that being said I would totally suggest getting the cheap plastic walkers. More so because the wood walkers are too heavy for little ones to turn and manipulate. Basically they can only go in a straight line until they have much better upper strength.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Well made, cute design
customer_reviews.text: So cute and well made, but impossible to turn. We have a long open stretch of hard wood for my little one to push this on, then a grown up has to turn it around for her. It was a first birthday present for our daughter and she enjoyed it. At first, we put a heavy medicine ball in the basket so that it didn't move too fast for her while she was learning to walk.
customer_reviews.author: Dela

customer_reviews.title: I can say that it is beautiful (vibrant colors
customer_reviews.text: My son is too young for this, but he will need it soon! I can say that it is beautiful (vibrant colors!), well-made (solid, no splinters), a breeze to assemble, and has a lot to offer the lil one to explore! UPDATE: 3 years (and another kid) later, this is still a sturdy and fun toy to have around. The kids loaf it up with things, or they push each other around in it. Great toy!
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Hogg

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves this. I like that I don’t have to worry about it tipping up in the front like all of those plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: pareli

customer_reviews.title: Good toy, too expensive
customer_reviews.text: It is a good toy and very sturdy. It's not AMAZING, and for the price point, it should be. There's nothing wrong with it other than its not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: M Bylock Klein

customer_reviews.title: If you love good design, you'll (and baby) love this
customer_reviews.text: We love this walker than our LO. After reading many reviews and talking to a few moms, we ended up buying this one (another mom's reco). It helped her learn to walk and now that she's walking (she's one) she doesn't really care for it. She does enjoy standing on it, while we push her around the house. she does like to spin the toys once a while (not all the time) which we think is OK. It's a very well made, cute looking toy that you can just keep in the house. If you like all things modern and simple, you'll love this. Overall a great investment and a great price at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: pri_s

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This walker is very sturdy. Would not buy another walker ever again. My son has learned to walk on this. He likes to sit in there with me carting him around. V-tech is very loud and worst of all tips over. The only thing is this walker goes in only one direction. So when he reached a wall I would have to change the direction of the walker. But I would think that would be the point, since the early walkers would not know how to do a side step. I could see how this can be annoying if older toddlers were playing with this, as with, grocery shopping or baby cart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My twins are 12 months and love this walker
customer_reviews.text: My twins are 12 months and love this walker! They take turns pushing each other in it, climbing in and out, putting toys into it, etc. They are big babies and this walker has never toppled over with their weight. I used to have the V-tech walker and gave it away because this is just SO MUCH BETTER... Not to mention more interesting for the kids!
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Great walker
customer_reviews.text: Got this when my son started trying to do some walking. He absolutely loved it, nothing but big smiles when he started walking around with it. Really helped him to start learning to balance and walk on his own. He is now walking on his own and still likes to push this around after throwing some toys in the front of it. Great product and I really like that it's made of wood instead of plastic. Very solid product and it will definitely last for the next kid in a year or so when it will be used a lot again.
customer_reviews.author: RF9928

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This has been great for my 8 month old. For the first couple days he would only walk when we were helping him but soon he was cruising along all by himself. A couple reviews mentioned plastic on the sides and mine did come like that but really they are three SMALL pieces of plastic around a wooden knobs, not a big deal in my mind. The rest of it is wood and is very sturdy. This is more expensive than some of the other ones I looked at but we have a few other toys from Hape and love their products, well worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Irish Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great walker/toy
customer_reviews.text: Best gift ever for our friends 1 year old. Assembled with included tools while she was pushing it because she wouldn’t let go. Helped transition to walking immensely 👍
customer_reviews.author: bordsprts

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stable walker wagon!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 8 month old who is dying to walk on her own. She was able to start cruising immediately (with me walking closely behind her). It is very stable, yes it is possible for it to tip but each parent needs to be a careful judge of their littles abilities and choose when it is safe for them to be on their own playing with this. But overall very stable. I love that is is all wooden, no plastic parts. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel O

customer_reviews.title: Great Wooden Walker
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and returned a different walker because it wasn't very well made. I wanted something somewhat natural looking, multifunctional and sturdy. Although this is pretty bright and less natural looking I have to admit, my kids can't stop playing with all of the cool activities! It doesn't hold as many toys as the wagon style walkers but it has no plastic pieces and it seems like it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and cute
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our son's first birthday. He loves it. It is good quality and really cute. Some reviewers mentioned the balls on the side being a potential choking hazard, but you'd basically have to rip the thing apart in order to loosen those parts. My only complaint is that it doesn't turn, but we knew that when we bought it and weren't surprised. I would gladly buy this again. The wagon compartment holds a good amount of our son's smaller toys, which helps to keep his play area clean.
customer_reviews.author: missturnstiles

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for our grandson. He is just starting to walk and as soon as it was set up he wanted to take off with it! It worked well on the living room rug but went a little too fast on the hardwood floors. But that is because he is a beginner at walking. It also has some playful things to do on the toy itself and a place where he can put things in to haul around. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jams

customer_reviews.title: Mother and baby approved!
customer_reviews.text: This walker was a birthday gift for my grandson to help him learn to walk. The reviews and product was as promised. The walker was very sturdy and the movable gears were a hit. My grandson loves to much it around and gather toys to put in the base. The height of the walker fit my 13 month old grandson perfectly. I would highly recommend this product for a safe and fun toy that is kid and mother approved.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Caudill

customer_reviews.title: Steady
customer_reviews.text: This cart hauls blocks or whatever is needed, keeping the little ones a bit more steady as they go. It is bright, fun and well built. The wheels have soft rubber treads to protect wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brevig

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Cute to look at. Definitely tips over when my baby tries to pull herself up holding the handle bar. It may be more useful once she starts walking more steadily but I thought that was the whole purpose of getting a walker like this? Wish there was something more sturdy that wouldn't tip over with the baby pulling herself self up. Not too thrilled with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chi doc

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, beautiful, fun.
customer_reviews.text: I wish the gears were wooden also, and there was a little more space for the abbacus beads to move, but my daughter generally loves this and is obsessed with standing right now, so it's been wonderful and useful. I put toys in the base and bring it all over to play, and she can practice standing and walking with it. I bought a wooden one so it wouldn't have annoying noises or songs that I would grow to hate, and this fit the bill beautifully. It's sturdy and good quality. Works great for us.
customer_reviews.author: Msas

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: The day this arrived by not-yet-walking-without-help 10 month old daughter crawled right over, stood up and took off across the room. Sturdy, well made and will certainly be passed down to someone else who needs it. My daughter, who is now running on her own, climbing stairs, etc. at 14 months, still pushes it around the kitchen. A great product that gave her confidence to take those first steps on her own.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Burger

customer_reviews.title: Most amazing walker out there
customer_reviews.text: Most amazing walker out there! It's meant to go straight, and doesn't turn corners, but we have really long hallways (condo) so it worked for us. I really think this helped my little one learn how to walk faster. It's made really well, and it looks really cute - not like those junky plastic looking walkers. We will definitely be saving this for #2 whenever that happens :)
customer_reviews.author: Miss Priss

customer_reviews.title: Easy Assembly and Perfect Learning Toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when my son started pulling himself up on anything he saw in our house. It took no more than 10 minutes to put together. It's an adorable learning toy that my son has loved since day one.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah L

customer_reviews.title: My kiddo loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction. My baby, who’s almost ready to walk on his own, just loves it. He needed a little help slowing it down at first, but now he walks (and almost runs) with it on his own. It’s heavy enough and well designed so that it doesn’t tip over when he’s pulling himself up on it.
customer_reviews.author: "vykk_2"

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, but baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: The wheels wobble so sometimes it goes fast and other times the rubbing of the wheels on the cart slow it down. The red paint is now coming off where the wheels rub. Other than that it’s great and baby LOVES it! She likes to ride it as much as she loves to push it
customer_reviews.author: Kim C.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Someone else mentioned that their kid rides this like a Segway
customer_reviews.text: Someone else mentioned that their kid rides this like a Segway. (SP?) My kid does too. I am amazed at how stable this thing is. My daughter has had this since she turned one and she LOVES it. She pushes it, gets in it, puts *&^% in it, tosses *&^%out of it, and likes to play with the little toys too. It is also incredibly attractive - out with the atrocious rainforest jumperoo and in with Hape Wonder Walker! Thank heavens. Like swapping tuperware for real plates.
customer_reviews.author: Dmarr Esolomon

customer_reviews.title: We'll be using this for years!
customer_reviews.text: I love the way it looks and my little guy loves to play with it. We got this when he was about 8 months and he immediately started playing with all of the fun things along the edges even before he could pull up with it. Now that he's almost a year, he's using it to learn to walk. We use it on carpet and although there isn't an adjustment resistance, it doesn't seem to go too fast for him. I think it could tip over. Our little guy has just figured out how to pull up on it without tipping it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Kervin

customer_reviews.title: Great, stable walker for little explorers
customer_reviews.text: This walker is worth the premium cost over other brands. It's very stable, and it's great quality. We've lent it to friends who had little ones learning to walk, and they've all raved about it. The bright colors, quality build, and stability are all key selling points. We also have a plastic V-Tech walker that my daughter got as a birthday gift, and there was no comparison in terms of what I chose to keep out for my daughter to use.
customer_reviews.author: Citygal9

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed, awful sound, doesn’t turn
customer_reviews.text: My son actually loves this and it seems sturdy however the wheels are wobbly (fall hazard and choke hazard because wheels have small parts) and they make an awful nails on chalkboard type sound. So we can’t use it. I would expect for the price something much better. Oh yeah, it also doesn’t turn! Poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Melf

customer_reviews.title: This is a really sturdy walker. Our son used this when he was ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really sturdy walker. Our son used this when he was first learning how to walk. He could pull himself up using the handle and even fall backwards without pulling the whole thing over on himself like many other baby walkers. Now that he's a fairly proficient walker, he loves to push his stuffed animals around in it!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Awful noise when moving
customer_reviews.text: My 11mo daughter enjoys playing with this but it was not made correctly. When she stands to walk with it, it makes the most awful nails on a chalk board noise. It's too late for me to return per amazon policy.
customer_reviews.author: Marliegirl22

customer_reviews.title: Cute infant toy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter likes it. I like that its made of wood and not all plastic like most newer toys. Rolls nicely on wood floors and wont scratch them due to the rubber on the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: BigD38

customer_reviews.title: Can't even put it together.
customer_reviews.text: The screw holes don't line up! This was supposed to have been the main Christmas gift for my son, but I can't even assemble it so back in the box it goes. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: A. Luepke

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy. We bought it for her when she was 8 months old. It weighs enough that she can lift herself using the walker and it will not topple over. She does laps around the house with it and even pushes our little dog around in it. We have used it on carpet, wood floor and out on the pavement. It rolls well and is a quality toy. So happy that she loves it and so happy that it's made in the USA/nontoxic paint and all wood. YAY! can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: very well built
customer_reviews.text: very well built and steady for the little one learning to walk.
customer_reviews.author: warehouseanimal

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful toy
customer_reviews.text: Great hit with the family of the baby for whom this was purchased as a Christmas gift. They live temporarily in very crowded quarters, so had to put most of the baby's toys from Christmas into storage but this toy was one of two that they have kept for apartment play. It provides a very stable base for practicing early walking skills plus it is colorful and exceptionally cute.
customer_reviews.author: bam

customer_reviews.title: Great product for small kids
customer_reviews.text: This walker came almost fully assembled. Just had to adjust a couple of screws and it's done! The structure itself is nice and sturdy. The wheels come with a rubber lining around the circumference so it doesn't slip easily on non-carpeted surfaces. The edges of the wood trims are well polished so no sharp edges are present to harm baby. The interactive "toy features" are also very well made and bright/colorful to attract baby's attention. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: kamechan

customer_reviews.title: Kid loves it
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, easy to assemble, perfect design for new walkers. But wheels come already assembled on axles and already connected to the wagon, have no washers between the wagon and the wheel...they're a bit wobbly and don't spin totally freely. It doesn't seem to bother the baby, just surprising for an otherwise well-made walker.
customer_reviews.author: NY JSC

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME
customer_reviews.text: AWSOME product, worth the money for little ones, my grandson loves pushing this cart around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful design, easy to assemble and greate product
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves it!! Best toy ever and it helps them to become stable walkers and also to play ilwith it and store her toys while moving it around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Ser

customer_reviews.title: Wheels not as pictures advertise. Safety risk!
customer_reviews.text: Returning this as the wheels are not attached as the Amazon product photos show. The screws stick out and are not flat like they should be. Very disappointing but I know my son will bite these at minimum and worse case actually hurt himself. (They stick out almost half an inch)
customer_reviews.author: Alex Smith

customer_reviews.title: perfect. Her other grandparents have purchased from the same ...
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter just loves this and has for over a year... perfect. Her other grandparents have purchased from the same manufacturer for other products. Love quality built products like the old days...
customer_reviews.author: jeff snider

customer_reviews.title: Solid Walker
customer_reviews.text: There is no doubt that this walker is sturdy. Nicely balanced, and the wheels turn in a way that makes it easy to help our boy walk at his own pace. He is 11 months old now, and needs assistance from us at this time, but I can see this walker will be an effective aid in his gaining confidence in walking, which is why we bought this. I feel like it is just a bit expensive, and some of the add ons affixed to the walker are not of the same quality as the walker itself - which isn't a big deal, but that combo prevents 5 star rating from me.
customer_reviews.author: Slimbo

customer_reviews.title: love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly do recommend this walker! it is beautifully made, the toys on it are fun, and the assembly is very easy. The design is well thought of! i am personally an architect and think that this was definitely well designed!!! my little boy loves pushing and pulling it around, he likes the toys on it as well. I love that it is made out of wood. The only thing on it that is plastic is the gears ( it would have been better if those were wood as well) other than that this was a great purchase!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sounny Slitine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old grandson loves this toy! He isn't walking yet but loves to pull up on it and it does not tip. He loves the little toys attached to it and liked to push it back and forth while sitting. Very very well made. Would highly recommend and will look for their toy brand on the future
customer_reviews.author: Mollie

customer_reviews.title: Great walker, nicely made
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice walker. I love Hape brand toys! We originally thought it would move too fast for our daughter who was not yet walking at 10.5 months, but she was able to use it by herself right away, so the lack of tension control didn't end up being a problem. Our daughter absolutely loved because able to walk with this before she was actually able to on her own.
customer_reviews.author: cgw123

customer_reviews.title: Love this walker
customer_reviews.text: Love this walker!!! My daughter just turned 1, she cannot walk yet. This has not flipped one time when she tries to pull up on it! I am SO pleased with that! We have hardwood floors throughout, so that was a big deal to me! The rubber/silicone on the wheels helps with traction and resistance, so it doesnt roll out from under her. She LOVES all the little gizmos on it. Especially the little gears on the side. She can put items in, and take them out. I'm so glad we bought this!
customer_reviews.author: Lena Rochester

customer_reviews.title: All pieces are sturdy. It also doesn't look that bad in the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is such a quality toy. My daughter started using it at 8 months. We of course hung on to it until she could pull herself up without pushing it. The rubber on the wheels help the pace to stay steady from carpet to wood. All pieces are sturdy. It also doesn't look that bad in the room compared to all the other bright plastic baby gear.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Trust the brand, love the toy
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful, versatile toy for your active toddler just learning to walk. We prefer wooden toys to plastic, and Hape is a brand that works at being environmentally friendly, using non-toxic paints, and supposedly treats its workers fairly.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great craftsmanship, sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Great craftsmanship, sturdy product. Definitely will be a heirloom passed down. My complaints are that you can't adjust how sensitive the wheels are for those babes just learning to walk...goes a little too fast even on the carpet. Also, it is very difficult even for me to turn. We did put weights in it to slow it down
customer_reviews.author: tiffer1285

customer_reviews.title: great wooden push cart option for near or recent walkers
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed, easy to put together, highly playable. My 14 month old has been walking for two months and still plays with this every single day in multiple different ways. Definitely worth the money. She adores it.
customer_reviews.author: Salem Leonard-Goosby

customer_reviews.title: Love love love.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect heavy wooden push toy. Excellent craftsmanship and heirloom quality. So happy with this walker and we already have sooo many memories with it. More importantly I feel my baby is safe when using this toy. It can be scary watching them learn how to walk.
customer_reviews.author: canalgal

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't tip over!!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves this walker push toy! It hasn't tipped over with him pulling up trying to learn to walk. He's 10 months old and even after learning to walk he can use it to "drive" his toys around in. It's a bit pricey but it's worth the money. Much better than the plastics walker toys on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Redcandies of NorCal

customer_reviews.title: It's better, in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: This walker helped our son to become more confident with his balancing and walking. It's better, in my opinion, than an adult holding the child's arms while they try to walk, because the adult is constantly inputing little corrections here and there, rather than letting the child respond to his/her own gravity.
customer_reviews.author: Ian R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Stabilizing Walker by High Quality Hape!
customer_reviews.text: This toy taught the little 9 1/2 month in our family the methods of Walking 101. Stable, smooth,and offers fantastic storage for ride along stuffed animals and toys. High quality and easy to assemble! Nice find.
customer_reviews.author: Ifyoureallywantthetruth

customer_reviews.title: It's adorable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson's first birthday. He was not walking yet, but took off being very stable with this cart. It's adorable and sturdy. I'd highly recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Gbehr

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, it's a hand-me-down toy for
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 1 year old grandson who was just walking. He loves it. Loves pushing it around and especially loves putting stuff up in it and then pushing around. Great quality, it's a hand-me-down toy for sure
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Quality not met and not easy assembling. Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The handle is not stabilized, the screws didn’t fitted. Dangerous when baby is leaning on it. It is seating in my garage. Wasted time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Such a great walker - high quality Hape as usual
customer_reviews.text: Such a great walker - high quality Hape as usual. We weighted down the cart for our 9 month old so it wouldn't tip backward as he was first using it. Endless fun pushing this all around our house!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Dozier

customer_reviews.title: My son LOVES this toy. He is only 10 ...
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this toy. He is only 10 months old and not walking yet, but he plays with all the toys on this walker. I can't wait until he can actually walk around with it, but for now we are still getting our money's worth with all of the activities that this walker has.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Love the product, but the wheels are squeaky
customer_reviews.text: Our kiddo loves this. Just wish the wheels didn't make such a squeaky noise.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. C

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: So far my son loves this! We add a little more weight in the front when he is pushing it but he even sits in it so we can push him.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Love that it's wood and seems to be well made
customer_reviews.text: Our 9 month old (now 10 months) started walking the second we put this in front of him. Love that it's wood and seems to be well made. A little squeaky...but that adds to it's appeal.
customer_reviews.author: gtr man

customer_reviews.title: gorgeous
customer_reviews.text: This is the best wooden walker wagon, hands down. Very attractive, lots to play with, good size and very sturdy. LOVE LOVE it. My son is only 5 months, but can sit with me and play with the gears and beads already. My 3 YO daughter loves to tote her animal buddies and books in it too! BONUS!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this wooden walker
customer_reviews.text: My one year old grandson loves the Hape Wonder Walker! Well built, colorful, and weigh and width make it steady. He pulls himself up and walks back and forth on wooden floors. He likes to put other toys in the compartment. I would recommend this wooden walker.
customer_reviews.author: DBR

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and great quality!! My daughter can pull herself up without it tipping over! She loves walking with it but also sitting in it for a ride :)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!! Safer for baby & she was more confident
customer_reviews.text: Mich sturdier fir baby. Wheels are great & depth to handle allows baby to achieve better balance.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: great walker
customer_reviews.text: I got this walker for my son when he was 10 month old. He liked it and was attracted to the gears and other little things he could touch and turn on the walker. This walker is sturdy and very stable, it never tips over even when he used to pull himself up holding on to the walker.
customer_reviews.author: T. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great product but I wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Great product but I wouldn't buy again. My daughter used it maybe 20 times during the very brief period between walking and crawling. Of all the baby products, this one has been used the least. The opposite of our Bjorn bouncer and our Step 2 push car, which we used more than we could ever imagine. I'd save this money for one of those items instead.
customer_reviews.author: zoe

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: I bought this walker for my baby girl who was 9 months old at the time. We decided on this one because it is made out of wood, has a few activities on it, our baby girl can grow into it, and it has a place to store other toys. Our baby girl is now 10 months old and has started to walk around using it and hasn't fallen over yet because of how sturdy and heavy it is. She loves to play with the different activities and stick her other toys into the storage place. I would definitely recommend this toy to anyone who has a baby boy or girl.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen B Hotai

customer_reviews.title: bought it used, still awesome :)
customer_reviews.text: Great, classy toy. I bought this for my 10 month old baby who is an accomplished couch cruiser, but won't stand or walk alone. It is sturdy enough for him to pull up on without tipping, and he walks behind it ( In a straight path only). The wheels have green rubber on them that grip the hardwood and carpet well when in use. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because when he pulls up on the side of it, it has a tendency to tip sideways because it is narrow. However, it's not really a long way to fall, so he gets up and tries again.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart and Cassie Reeh

customer_reviews.title: My 9 month old son loves walking with this walker ...
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old son loves walking with this walker. The cause and effect toys on the walker itself is also very entertaining for my son. Everything about this walker just exudes quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cenox

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful walker
customer_reviews.text: Love this walker. Well made, beautiful, and LO loves it. Has yet to tip over when he pulls himself up, and has nice control on hard floors. We take tons of pics with him playing with his walker and looks really nice on pics too!
customer_reviews.author: Hyungbina

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhh, not worth it.  Too light.  Not enough traction to be used for its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special. I ended up returning it. It was too light to actually pull up on properly and use as an early walker - I ended up putting 2, 5lb weights in it and that helped but I still ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Our granddaughter took to it right way and ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Our granddaughter took to it right way and loves it. She was walking, laughing and having so much fun. I love the wooden construction and I highly recommend the Hape Wonder Walker.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Segway
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best quality big toy we've gotten for our kids under 3. My 14 month old stands on it so we started calling it his segway. Amazingly it does not tip over. The build and weight distribution is perfect for all sorts of pushing, climbing, etc. Would definitely recommend, even if your baby can already walk.
customer_reviews.author: A Reputable Source

customer_reviews.title: Great walker!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of searching around, trying to find something that would not easily tip over. I'm glad I chose Hape--this is a great, and very sturdy walker. I love that the wheels have rubber on them to make it slower on carpet. None of the "activities" on here seem to interest my daughter, but that's okay because to me the most important part is that she's not going to accidentally pull it down on herself. I also like that there's a little "storage" area so she can push around other little toys like blocks or stuffed animals. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Hipster toy
customer_reviews.text: Cool toy for a new walker and the right height. Holds toys, too, which makes it handy. Finished so it can be wiped down when needed.
customer_reviews.author: College Jane

customer_reviews.title: It also looks very nice in our home
customer_reviews.text: This push-toy helped my son start walking, and he still loves it, even though he is now a competent walker. He enjoys putting toys in it and pushing it into another room. It also looks very nice in our home. Sturdy construction, great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Hape Wonder Walker
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grandson who is going from crawling to walking. It DOES NOT tip when he pulls himself up. Lots of onboard activities for a child.
customer_reviews.author: robert c. munger

customer_reviews.title: which is great. Only complaint is that the wheels do wobble ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this! It has definitely helped with his transition from pre-walking to walking. And he can pull himself up on it without it flipping over, which is great. Only complaint is that the wheels do wobble a bit, and are starting to squeak. Nothing a little TLC can't fix, though.
customer_reviews.author: hiodom

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this! It's very top heavy so she and I both feel confident with her ability to pull up and use it with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi K

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully constructed! I do wish the front wheels turned to make turning easier!
customer_reviews.author: JA Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Love it so worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Love it so worth the money! My little one is chunky so I was worried a smaller light weight walker wouldn't work. This one is nice and sturdy not easy to tip over it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: 19Nicole20

customer_reviews.title: Great for Sit to Stand
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Only tipped over once, but usually never tips over. Very sturdy! My son loves it, and has been using it since he learned how to stand up. Actually, I think this product helped him learn to stand up and walk.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ross

customer_reviews.title: My child loves this toy. (and we love the sturdiness)
customer_reviews.text: Update: 13 month old has had it for about 8 weeks now. Very sturdy, even when all toys get dumped out and he stands in it. No scuff marks on walls, doors, moulding, or tile floors. OP: I wanted to stay away from plastic/shiny/loud and stick with tactile/wood/non-toxic paint. This product is designed in Europe and conforms to European safety standards and although manufactured in China, global certificates of inspection are available at the Hape site in pdf format. This is a good and sturdy push walker, very colorful, and my child truly enjoys playing with it. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: It is worth your money: very good quality toy, and yes, you get what you pay for. It is not cheap, but if you want something nice, sturdy, and safe for your child, this is the product you're looking for.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Excellent desing,safe and perfect for a tall baby.
customer_reviews.author: Anneris

product_meta.title: Award Winning Hape Wonder Walker Push and Pull Toddler Walking Toy
product_meta.description:
Get ready world! With the best-selling Wonder Walker from Hape toys your child will be ready to walk and roll! Setback wheels provide a sturdy base for kids to pull up, and the unique design makes pushing a breeze while encouraging first steps. Moveable knobs, gears and colorful balls turn it into a busy-box on wheels. The rubber lining of the wheels make this a great choice for kids, while the storage base offers room for friends to come along for the ride! Easy 15 minute assembly and your child will be all set to go discover the world! Durable child-safe paint finish and solid wood construction make this a toy your child will love for years to come. Made with wood from environmentally sourced forests. Hape toys stimulate children through every stage of development and help nurture and develop their natural abilities. All Hape products sold in North America meet or exceed all applicable safety standards. The Wonder Walker is a proud recipient of the 2011 Parent's Choice Approved Award.

BRAND STORY
By Hape
feature_bullets: Moveable knobs, gears, and colorful balls offer five different activities
Develops coordination and fine motor skills
Carefully designed rubber-trimmed setback wheels will protect floors
Sturdy wood craftsmanship from sustainably sourced forests
Non-toxic finishes and child safe materials

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars429 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
